tweet: If we continue to let states decide what benefits are covered, we will exacerbate the inequalities in our health care system. We can't wait for states to do the right thing because some never will – look at what happened with Medicaid expansion. Medicare for America fixes this.

We also worked closely with our friends in the disabilities community to establish the gold standard for LTSS and ensure the needs of individuals and families with chronic illness and disabilities were incorporated into all aspects of Medicare for America. pic.twitter.com/skvdjdBj4N

We want to ensure no matter who's in charge at HHS, comprehensive benefits are guaranteed. The current healthcare debate largely ignores that Medicaid covers over 74m low-income and disabled individuals. Fun fact: we based our benefits package on CT’s comprehensive HUSKY program. pic.twitter.com/DYkwiW9gZF

Right now, your zip code defines what benefits you have. State laws vary, state Medicaid plans vary, and that should not be the case. Every person enrolled in Medicare for America will have the exact same benefits regardless of where you live. pic.twitter.com/gH8L67UYAh

It’s time that we start to talk about what benefits will be covered under a universal system, like Medicare for America. There’s a reason why we are so specific in what will be covered. pic.twitter.com/aJkf7SQwdp

Medicare for America gets us to universal coverage by building on and expanding Medicare’s benefits package to all Americans. Healthcare should not be determined by your zip code. Learn more here -> https://m.huffpost.com/us/entry/us_5ccb16dce4b0e4d7572f4686?guccounter=1&guce_referrer=aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZ29vZ2xlLmNvbS8&guce_referrer_sig=AQAAAEIIHwbOuyj9wyCgbPToIu0Ri41m5Mh8N_xn0i4yyxCZBHjO3Rv0Qri8b07Z0faxd0OO10_FLuxXV-pAUxoA589_w9ZwZvcofR7dnaq6Z1M4PSiNBPCcJILTqr4R-PTFMNFVc8-z233UJwJpx7krj4KyoVzLVaUPWEyb3RR5Ultd …

Acting Secretary Patrick Pizzella’s checkered past on these issues—including lobbying with convicted felon Jack Abramoff on behalf of sweatshops and pushing anti-worker policies as a member of the Federal Labor Relations Authority—make him unfit to lead the Department of Labor.

And his policies hurt our nation’s workers, including victims of wage theft, human trafficking, and workers facing dangerous conditions. President Trump must nominate someone who will fight for workers and reverse these damaging policies.

Beyond that, Acosta systematically dismantled and hollowed out the Department of Labor, which is tasked with protecting working people. He proposed a $1.2 billion budget cut to the Department just this year.
As U.S. Attorney in Miami, Acosta effectively ended an ongoing FBI investigation into Epstein that could have turned up much if not all of the heinous crimes we are learning about now.

Secretary Acosta made the right choice by stepping down. His sweetheart deal for Jeffrey Epstein—who sexually abused children—was indefensible. https://www.npr.org/2019/07/12/739881163/alexander-acosta-steps-down-as-labor-secretary-amid-epstein-controversy …
